newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares open down, Sembawang Maritime up.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares open down, Sembawang Maritime up.

text.p: The Singapore share market opened flat on Friday with some buying focus on stocks in the news, dealers said.
The 30-share Straits Times Industrials Index dropped 1.03 points to 2,161.70 at 0230 GMT following a Wall Street surge of 43.65 points to 5,733.47.
Yet another takeover offer stirred the market. Sembawang Corp's Thursday announcement of a voluntary takeover of Sembawang Maritime Ltd boosted its share price on Friday.

Sembawang Maritime Ltd (SML) jumped to Singapore $4.00 in early trade before dropping back to S$3.76, up 54 cents or 16.77 percent. Dealers said punters were pushing the SML price up because it was lower than the offer price at S$3.70.
In addition, news on CAM International's diversification into two high-technology vegetable farms attracted attention and its trading volume shot up.
Cam International saw 6.0 million shares crossed at a high S$1.02. Its share was up S$0.05 to S$0.79 on a turnover of 1.41 million shares.
Market volume was 32.89 million shares with gainers leading losers by 114 to 42.
